snippet: We need to improve the state of our schools for health professionals, to fill needs at home and reduce the flood of imported health workers, who are needed in their own countries.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Kate Tulenko argues that America needs to improve the state of schools for health professionals, which have failed to increase their efficiency and output despite rapidly rising demand; notes that the US now imports about 12 percent of its health care work force at a high cost from other countries, largely due to excessive regulations and unnecessarily high credential requirements for domestic workers.
lead_paragraph: We need to improve the state of our schools for health professionals, to fill needs at home and reduce the flood of imported health workers, who are needed in their own countries.
